Test Name: Mycoplasma genitalium Detection by Transcription-Mediated Amplification (TMA)
Specimen Type: First-catch urine and urogenital swab (urethral, endocervical, or vaginal)
Purpose: To detect the presence of Mycoplasma genitalium in urine or urogenital swab specimens using TMA technology.
Container: Sterile urine collection container or manufacturer-recommended TMA swab transport tube/medium
Equipment: TMA instrument (e.g., Hologic Panther system), centrifuge, calibrated pipettes
